questions.text: A 28-year-old man is brought by his wife. He continues to hear internal voices, which are telling him that the police and the CBI are after him. On physical examination, although he is cooperative, you notice that he has a flat, blunt affect. You decide to start him to a medication that will treat both the positive and negative symptoms of schizophrenia, although you informed his wife that keep towel over pillow while sleeping. Which drug u planned?

All of the following are monoamine oxidase inhibitors EXCEPT:
A patient presents with head injury and severe musculoskeletal pain. All the following drugs can be given except:
All are opioid pure antagonists except:
All are appropriately matched tricyclic antidepressant and metabolite except:

A 12-year-old boy is brought to your clinic by his mother, that her son has been suffering of bed wetting. Upon speaking with the boy, he tells you that he has been feeling depressed since he is being bullied at school. Drug best to be used for treatment in this boy is?
Which of the following is not a side effect of haloperidol
The neurotransmitter through which benzodiazepines exert their action is:

A 38-year-old woman presents to your clinic complaining that whenever she brushes her teeth or chews vigorously, she feels excruciating  pain on her left cheek. Which drug is best to prescribe to her to treat this condition?
Valproate causes all except

choices.text: Continue same drug in lower dose
Taper down and stop the drug

questions.text: A 19 year old female is on valproate to treat her seizures. Since last 2 year no episode of seizure occurred. Now she came to the physician for reviewing the treatment as she is getting married. What best advice you will give to her for next step:
Clinical uses of Valproate include the following, except:
Which antiepileptic does not act via sodium channel blockade:

A 45-year-old moderately obese man has been drinking regularly for last 15 years and tried to quit many times but not able to do it because of withdrawal symptoms. With this history, this man is at significant risk for these withdrawal symptoms except:

choices.text: Transient fall in BUN and serum creatinine

questions.text: A recognized side effect of  lithium carbonate is:

choices.text: Bronchiolar smooth muscle contraction occurs during halothane anaesthesia
Epilepsy risk high after use of isoflurane
Use of propofol having antiemetic property
The use of thiopental causes cerebral steal phenomenon

questions.text: Which statement concerning the effects of anesthetic agents is true?

choices.text: Most commonly used drug in parkinsonism
Metoclopramide blocks vomiting & it’s therapeutic potential

questions.text: All of the following statements are true regarding Levodopa treatment in parkinsonism except:

A 45-year-old foreigner male patient presents to your clinic, complaining of insomnia. The patient states that he has not been able to sleep since he shifted to india at his job. In addition to advising the patient on good sleep hygiene practices, Which therapy you may consider for this patient?
Which of the following is not an ultrashort – acting barbiturate?
Best drug to manage juvenile myoclonic epilepsy ?

choices.text: A need to continually increase drug dosage because of tolerance
An effect of the drug on cognition
That the drug is likely to take a week or more to begin working
That if he stops taking the drug abruptly, he will experience withdrawal signs

questions.text: A 24-year-old stockbroker has developed a “nervous disposition.” Diagnosed as suffering from generalized anxiety disorder, he is prescribed alprazolam. The patient should be informed to anticipate all except:

Fetal-hydantoin syndrome is seen in case of

choices.text: Used during randomized controlled clinical trails
Naloxone cannot block placebo induced analgesia
Placebo effects are highly variable even in the same individual

questions.text: Which of the following is false about placebo?

A 20-year-old male patient scheduled for hernia surgery was anesthetized with halothane and nitrous oxide; tubocurarine was provided for skeletal muscle relaxation. The patient rapidly developed tachycardia and became hypertensive. Generalized skeletal muscle rigidity was accompanied by marked hyperthermia. The patient should be treated immediately with:
All acts via GABAA except:
Which of the following is associated with renal stones:

choices.text: Conjugated via glucuronidation and excreted via kidney

questions.text: A patient with liver dysfunction is scheduled for a surgical procedure. Lorazepam can be used for preanesthetic sedation in this patient without special concern regarding excessive CNS depression because these drugs are:

choices.text: No treatment is available for above indication

A 38-year-old man with a history of major depressive disorder presents to psychiatrist 3 months ago. he was started on fluoxetine. Today after taking his migraine tablet he is having irritability, rigidity, shivering, diarrhea, rapid heartbeat & high blood pressure. Which drug of migraine stimulated this reaction?
